{{Distinguish|Hebrew Wikipedia}} {{Expand Yiddish|◊ô◊ô◊ì◊ô◊©◊¢ ◊ï◊ï◊ô◊ß◊ô◊§◊¢◊ì◊ô◊¢|date=August 2011}} {{Infobox website | name = [[Image:Wikipedia-favicon.png|16px|Favicon of Wikipedia]] Yiddish Wikipedia | screenshot = | logo = Wikipedia-logo-v2-yi.png | logo_size = 140px | caption = | url = [http://yi.wikipedia.org/ yi.wikipedia.org] | commercial = No | location = [[Miami, Florida]] | type = [[Internet encyclopedia project]] | language = [[Yiddish language|Yiddish]] | registration = Optional | owner = [[Wikimedia Foundation]] | author = }} '''Yiddish Wikipedia''' is the [[Yiddish]]-language version of [[Wikipedia]]. It was founded on March 3, 2004,<ref>{{cite web|first1 = |last1 = |first2 = |last2 = |first3 = |last3 = |first4 = |last4 = |title = Yiddish Wikipedia now active |url = http://comments.gmane.org/gmane.science.linguistics.wikipedia.international/2933|date = March 16, 2004|publisher = wikipedia.international mailinglist|website = |accessdate = September 1, 2014}}</ref> and the first article was written November 28 of that year.
==Current status== The Yiddish Wikipedia now has {{NUMBEROF|ARTICLES|yi|N}} articles. There are {{NUMBEROF|USERS|yi|N}} registered users (including bots); {{NUMBEROF|ACTIVEUSERS|yi|N}} are active, including {{NUMBEROF|ADMINS|yi|N}} administrators.
Like all Wikipedias it generates hits from Yiddish words typed in Google, with Wikipedia articles appearing at the top of the results for that word.
In accordance with the norms for the Yiddish language, it is written almost exclusively in Hebrew script, and not in Latin script.
== Milestones == The Yiddish Wikipedia reached 6,000 articles on March 8, 2009. The 6,000th article is [[:yi:◊ô◊î◊ï◊©◊¢ ◊î◊¢◊©◊ô◊ú ◊™◊ê◊ï◊û◊ô◊ù-◊§◊®◊¢◊†◊ß◊ú (◊ë)|◊ô◊î◊ï◊©◊¢ ◊î◊¢◊©◊ô◊ú ◊™◊ê◊ï◊û◊ô◊ù-◊§◊®◊¢◊†◊ß◊ú]], a rabbi. The 7,000th article is [[:yi:◊ó◊†◊ô◊†◊ê ◊°◊í◊ü ◊î◊õ◊î◊†◊ô◊ù|◊ó◊†◊ô◊†◊ê ◊°◊í◊ü ◊î◊õ◊î◊†◊ô◊ù]], a page about the [[Tannaim|tanna]] [[Hanina Segan ha-Kohanim]] created on December 24, 2009.
==Point of view== Combined, the different [[Hasidic]] groups form the largest Yiddish-speaking community in the world today. Most new articles are about Hasidic rabbis.<ref>[[:yi:◊ë◊ê÷∑◊ñ◊ï◊†◊ì◊¢◊®:◊†◊ô◊ô◊¢ ◊ë◊ú◊¢◊ò◊¢◊®]]</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}

Yes. It's not a mistake. It's Yiddish]. [[Ynet]] ([[Hebrew]]) * Dr. Shalom Berger, [http://yiddish.forward.com/archive/forverts/2006/1027/item4.html An encyclopedia of people already in Yiddish] [[The Forward]] ([[Yiddish]]) * [http://www.themarker.com/tmc/article.jhtml?ElementId=skira20061006_45454&origin=ibo&layer=headlines&layer2=&layer3= Is there such a thing as a '''Free Encyclopedia'''?: - The Yiddish Wikipedia was the only Wikipedia which did not delete an article which a journalist has written his own autobiography]. [[TheMarker]] ([[Hebrew]])
{{Wikipedias}}

{{Infobox writer <!-- for more information see [[:Template:Infobox writer/doc]] --> | name = Youssof Kohzad <!-- Commented out because image was deleted: | image = ykohzad.JPG --> | caption = '''ŸäŸàÿ≥ŸÅ ŸÉŸáÿ≤ÿßÿØ''' | birth_date = 1935 | birth_place = [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Novelist, writer, poet, actor, playwright | genre = [[realism (arts)|Dramatic Arts]] | movement = | notableworks =''[[When God Created Beauty]]'' | website = }} '''Youssof Kohzad''' ([[Persian language|Persian]]: <big>ŸäŸàÿ≥ŸÅ ŸÉŸáÿ≤ÿßÿØ</big>; also spelled '''Youssef Kohzad''') (born 1935) is an ethnic [[Tajiks|Tajik]] [[writer]], [[Painting|painter]], [[playwright]], [[artist]], [[poet]], [[actor]], and [[art consultant]] from Afghanistan. He has now taken residence in [[Tracy, California]], United States since his [[emigration]] from [[Afghanistan]]. He is married to [[Zakia Kohzad]].
== Background ==
Youssef Kohzad was born in 1935 in the Chendawol district of Kabul, Afghanistan. During his high school years, he wrote plays and created artwork for [[Kabul Theater]]. Kohzad graduated from Nejat (Amani) High School in Kabul in 1953. He finished his formal art education from the [[Academy of Art]] in [[Rome, Italy]] in 1965. After returning from Italy, he traveled to the former [[Soviet Union]], India and former Eastern Germany to exhibit his art along with other contemporary Afghan artists. Many of his works are showcased in the Middle Eastern Studies museums in [[Moscow]].
From 1966-1969 he held executive positions at the [[Ministry of Media and Culture]], in which he was the head of the [[Fine Arts]] Department.
In 1971 he became the art consultant of Kabul Theater. He wrote eight dramas and all were played on stage. In many of the plays, he played the lead role.
In 1975 he returned to the Ministry of Media and Culture and held the position as the president of the ministry until 1992.
In 1976, he founded the [[National Gallery]] in Kabul, which included 700 paintings, and some work dating back a hundred years. Unfortunately, out of the 700 works of art only 30 remain today.
From 1992 until August 2000, Kohzad became a [[Afghan refugees|refugee]] along with his family and was forced to immigrate to India. In August 2000, he moved to the United States and has been residing in [[Northern California]] since then. His first art exhibit in the United States was held in August 2001 in [[Palo Alto]].
== Education ==
* 1965: Academy of Art (Rome, Italy)
== Online Poems ==
*Black Pearls **[http://kohzad.blogfa.com/]
== Works ==
*'''''Aspects of Beauty in Art''''' *'''''Kohzad: A collection of Poetry''''' *'''''When God Created Beauty'''''
== References == *CBS Radio Network. '''''Afghan Art in Exile.''''' February 4, 2002. *Youssef Kohzad Profile: [http://www.afghanmagazine.com/profile/ykohzad/index.html]
